title.narrative: OPT 2.1. POLICIES, STANDARDS AND M&E SYSTEM FOR QUALITY EDUCATION

description.narrative: National and subnational institutions responsible for education, have improved capacity to design and implement policies and a monitoring system to support the quality of education with focus on inter-, intra- and multilingual education in at least two of the four departments receiving UNICEF support., which contributes to Access To Quality Learning Opportunities, Equitable Access To Quality Education, Learning, Skills, Participation And Engagement. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2022, children and adolescents, especially the most disadvantaged, have increased access to, learning and completion of quality education services, including in emergency situations.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: National and subnational institutions responsible for education, have improved capacity to design and implement policies and amonitoring system to support the quality of education with focus on inter-, intra- and multilingual education in at least two ofthe four departments receiving UNICEF support.

description.narrative: New analyses of lessons learned, teaching strategy adjustments and stronger actions plans are in place to ensure children and adolescents safely return to classes in 2022. Relevant and robust evidence was generated to inform policy decisions in the Education Sector with UNICEF’s support. Two studies were completed on education access and quality through the Plurinational Observatory of Educational Quality (OPCE). These UNICEF-supported studies provided information to guide educational policies within the COVID-19 context, analyzed the state of the education system during 2020 and reviewed monitoring data on, school conditions for a safe return to schools and students’ learning achievements. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:22/12/2021
